GET /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database.description: Returns a list of D1 databases.

schema.description: a database name to search for.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

created_at.description: Specifies the timestamp the resource was created as an ISO8601 string.

count.description: Total number of results for the requested service

page.description: Current page within paginated list of results

per_page.description: Number of results per page of results

total_count.description: Total results available without any search parameters

success.description: Whether the API call was successful
Whether the API call was successful

result.description: The details of the D1 database.

created_at.description: Specifies the timestamp the resource was created as an ISO8601 string.

file_size.description: The D1 database's size, in bytes.

mode.description: The read replication mode for the database. Use 'auto' to create replicas and allow D1 automatically place them around the world, or 'disabled' to not use any database replicas (it can take a few hours for all replicas to be deleted).

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

POST /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/.description:
Returns a URL where the SQL contents of your D1 can be downloaded. Note: this process may take
some time for larger DBs, during which your D1 will be unavailable to serve queries. To avoid
blocking your DB unnecessarily, an in-progress export must be continually polled or will automatically cancel.

current_bookmark.description: To poll an in-progress export, provide the current bookmark (returned by your first polling response)

no_data.description: Export only the table definitions, not their contents

no_schema.description: Export only each table's contents, not its definition

tables.description: Filter the export to just one or more tables. Passing an empty array is the same as not passing anything and means: export all tables.

output_format.description: Specifies that you will poll this endpoint until the export completes

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

at_bookmark.description: The current time-travel bookmark for your D1, used to poll for updates. Will not change for the duration of the export task.

error.description: Only present when status = 'error'. Contains the error message.

messages.description: Logs since the last time you polled

signed_url.description: The URL to download the exported SQL. Available for one hour.

200.description: Polled successfully, task no longer running (errored or complete)

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

at_bookmark.description: The current time-travel bookmark for your D1, used to poll for updates. Will not change for the duration of the export task.

messages.description: Logs since the last time you polled

202.description: Polled successfully, task is currently running

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

POST /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/.description:
Generates a temporary URL for uploading an SQL file to, then instructing the D1 to import it
and polling it for status updates. Imports block the D1 for their duration.

action.description: Indicates you have a new SQL file to upload.

etag.description: Required when action is 'init' or 'ingest'. An md5 hash of the file you're uploading. Used to check if it already exists, and validate its contents before ingesting.

action.description: Indicates you've finished uploading to tell the D1 to start consuming it

etag.description: An md5 hash of the file you're uploading. Used to check if it already exists, and validate its contents before ingesting.

filename.description: The filename you have successfully uploaded.

action.description: Indicates you've finished uploading to tell the D1 to start consuming it

current_bookmark.description: This identifies the currently-running import, checking its status.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

at_bookmark.description: The current time-travel bookmark for your D1, used to poll for updates. Will not change for the duration of the import. Only returned if an import process is currently running or recently finished.

error.description: Only present when status = 'error'. Contains the error message that prevented the import from succeeding.

filename.description: Derived from the database ID and etag, to use in avoiding repeated uploads. Only returned when for the 'init' action.

messages.description: Logs since the last time you polled

final_bookmark.description: The time-travel bookmark if you need restore your D1 to directly after the import succeeded.

changed_db.description: Denotes if the database has been altered in some way, like deleting rows.

changes.description: Rough indication of how many rows were modified by the query, as provided by SQLite's `sqlite3_total_changes()`.

duration.description: The duration of the SQL query execution inside the database. Does not include any network communication.

last_row_id.description: The row ID of the last inserted row in a table with an `INTEGER PRIMARY KEY` as provided by SQLite. Tables created with `WITHOUT ROWID` do not populate this.

rows_read.description: Number of rows read during the SQL query execution, including indices (not all rows are necessarily returned).

rows_written.description: Number of rows written during the SQL query execution, including indices.

served_by_primary.description: Denotes if the query has been handled by the database primary instance.

served_by_region.description: Region location hint of the database instance that handled the query.

size_after.description: Size of the database after the query committed, in bytes.

sql_duration_ms.description: The duration of the SQL query execution inside the database. Does not include any network communication.

num_queries.description: The total number of queries that were executed during the import.

upload_url.description: The R2 presigned URL to use for uploading. Only returned when for the 'init' action.

200.description: Successful action. Import is either ready to start, under way, or finished (succeeded or failed).

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

at_bookmark.description: The current time-travel bookmark for your D1, used to poll for updates. Will not change for the duration of the import.

messages.description: Logs since the last time you polled

202.description: Polled successfully, task is currently running

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

POST /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/.summary: Import SQL into your D1 Database

POST /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/.description: Returns the query result as an object.

sql.description: Your SQL query. Supports multiple statements, joined by semicolons, which will be executed as a batch.
sql.example: SELECT * FROM myTable WHERE field = ? OR field = ?;

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

duration.description: The duration of the SQL query execution inside the database. Does not include any network communication.

sql_duration_ms.description: The duration of the SQL query execution inside the database. Does not include any network communication.
